isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AND DOUBLE REDUCTION SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - ADJUST/INSTALL - INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER ASSEMBLY

note.para: Before installing carrier assembly, inspect and thoroughly clean interior of axle housing.

Use silicone rubber gasket compound on axle housing mating surface as shown in Figure 54. Install carrier before compound sets or reapply. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended gasket materials.

figure.caption: Figure 54. Axle Housing Silicone Gasket Compound Pattern

step1.para: Install differential carrier assembly in axle housing. Install bolts, nuts and lockwashers. Tighten to correct torque (refer to the TORQUE CHART).
Install axle shafts and stud nuts. Connect driveline.
For electric shift units, connect electrical wires. Install shift unit, nuts and washers. Tighten nuts to correct torque (refer to the , TORQUE CHART).
For air shift units, connect air line. Install shift unit, nuts and washers. Tighten nuts to correct torque (refer to the TORQUE CHART).

note.para: Additional information on electric and air shift units can be found in CTS-5166 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: Fill axle with correct lube. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

note.para: When axle has been disassembled or housing, gears, axle shafts or wheel equipment replaced, check axle assembly for proper differential action before operating vehicle. Wheels must rotate freely and independently.
